describe: Djibouti is a small country located in the Horn of Africa. It is bordered by Eritrea to the north, Ethiopia to the west and south, and Somalia to the southeast. The country has a strategic location near some of the world's busiest shipping lanes, controlling access to the Red Sea and Indian Ocean. Djibouti is known for its arid climate, diverse culture, and unique geological features such as salt lakes and volcanic formations.

cities.name: üèù Djibouti City
cities.geographical_location: Located on the eastern coast of Djibouti, along the Gulf of Tadjoura.
cities.climate: Djibouti City has a hot desert climate with very little rainfall throughout the year.
cities.famous_cuisine: Famous local dishes include Skoudehkaris (a spiced lamb stew) and Fah-fah (a spicy soup).

cities.name: üèù Tadjoura
cities.geographical_location: Situated on the northern shore of the Gulf of Tadjoura.
cities.climate: Tadjoura experiences a hot desert climate, with high temperatures and minimal rainfall.
cities.famous_cuisine: Known for its fresh seafood dishes and traditional Somali-influenced cuisine.
